Description: Steatite shabti of Ramose with incised decoration including a striped lappet-wig, a carved face, a collar and a pectoral containing a kheper-beetle, the low-relief hands holding the two incised hoes, the waist is decorated with two Wedjat-eyes and a representation of Nut with outspread wings, the front of the legs is inscribed with a column of incised hieroglyphs, the sides are inscribed with four rows of similar hieroglyphs, the back of the legs is inscribed with a central column of hieroglyphs, the back is decorated with a representation of a seed-basket.
